title: Using Color
text: free decide color segments ethograms using geom_ethogram().
code: ggplot(wombats, aes(y = wombat,                       behaviour = behaviour)) +      geom_ethogram(remove_nas = FALSE, color="salmon") #> Warning: Using `size` aesthetic for lines was deprecated in ggplot2 3.4.0. #> ℹ Please use `linewidth` instead.

title: Using Color
text: can also choose use color based column present data. example, can color wombat:  Perhaps common use color using behaviour:  Note using remove_nas=FALSE, produce different output using default:
code: ggplot(wombats, aes(y = wombat,                       behaviour = behaviour)) +      geom_ethogram(aes(color=wombat),                     remove_nas = FALSE) ggplot(wombats, aes(y = wombat,                       behaviour = behaviour)) +      geom_ethogram(aes(color=behaviour),                     remove_nas = FALSE) ggplot(wombats, aes(y = wombat,                       behaviour = behaviour)) +      geom_ethogram(aes(color=behaviour))

title: Using Color
text: article revisit basic usage adding color. explore uses see Using Trials

title: Basic Examples
text: plot ethogram, need know: x xend y axis observations must grouped together color segments (Optional) However, bare minimum, users potentially get away just: y axis observations must grouped together philosophy behind geom_ethogram() facilitate user experience. use cases, observations ordered according way temporally collected. Thus, reasonable geom_ethogram() assume y observations ordered time use implied order calculate x xend using certain heuristics. want transparent guessing temporal structure, provide verbose output x /xend missing. Ethograms can easily contain data aggregated thousands observations (e.g., videos 30fps). guessing interval forces us plot . prevent unnecessary plotting, geom_ethogram() aggregates continuous behaviors (.e., instead plotting 3 blocks length 1, plot 1 block length 3). function implemented behaviour aesthetic, allows us free typical ggplot2 aesthethics group coluor uses. Finally, geom_ethogram() remove NAs data default. can change setting remove_na=FALSE (see NA handling).

title: Basic Examples
text: article contains information geom_ethogram() handles x axis computation different aes() calls data types. examples, see Using Color.

title: Basic Examples
text: Frames provided implied order geom_ethogram() guess interval 1. x axis “sample space” (.e., 1:n_samples).  case providing frame = 1:n() column (named putative video frame ID). wombats dataset already contains column.  sampling period known (e.g., 5 seconds), ’s easy go frame (e.g., 1, 2, 3) seconds (e.g., 5, 10, 15 seconds).
code: # Frames in implied order ggplot(wombats, aes(y = wombat,                      behaviour = behaviour)) +   geom_ethogram()  #> Warning: Using `size` aesthetic for lines was deprecated in ggplot2 3.4.0. #> ℹ Please use `linewidth` instead. # Frames of uniform duration 1 ggplot(wombats, aes(x = frame,                      y = wombat, behaviour = behaviour)) +   geom_ethogram()  #> No observation interval provided, using guessed interval 1 #> No observation interval provided, using guessed interval 1 #> No observation interval provided, using guessed interval 1 #> No observation interval provided, using guessed interval 1 # Observations at uniform intervals ggplot(wombats,         aes(x = seconds,             y = wombat,             behaviour = behaviour)) +   geom_ethogram() #> No observation interval provided, using guessed interval 5 #> No observation interval provided, using guessed interval 5 #> No observation interval provided, using guessed interval 5 #> No observation interval provided, using guessed interval 5

title: Basic Examples
code: # Observations at specified datetimes with uniform 5-second intervals ggplot(wombats_duration, aes(x = start_dt, y = wombat, behaviour = behaviour)) +   geom_ethogram() +   facet_wrap(~ trial, scales = "free") #> No observation interval provided, using guessed interval 13 #> Warning: Computation failed in `stat_etho()` #> Caused by error in `rle()`: #> ! 'x' must be a vector of an atomic type #> No observation interval provided, using guessed interval 2 #> Warning: Computation failed in `stat_etho()` #> Caused by error in `rle()`: #> ! 'x' must be a vector of an atomic type #> No observation interval provided, using guessed interval 16 #> Warning: Computation failed in `stat_etho()` #> Caused by error in `rle()`: #> ! 'x' must be a vector of an atomic type #> No observation interval provided, using guessed interval 3 #> Warning: Computation failed in `stat_etho()` #> Caused by error in `rle()`: #> ! 'x' must be a vector of an atomic type

title: Basic Examples
text: produce plot looks strange compared ones. ’s just NAs also shown. data complete, plots examples look similar plot show might want look using color.
code: # Frames in implied order ggplot(wombats, aes(y = wombat,                      behaviour = behaviour)) +   geom_ethogram(remove_nas = FALSE)

title: Basic Examples
text: using package, ’s possible avoid providing enough information us compute proper ethogram. example, can accidentaly transform ethogram bar plot.
code: ggplot(wombats,          aes(y = behaviour,              behaviour = behaviour,              group=behaviour)) +      geom_ethogram(remove_nas = F) +    facet_wrap(~wombat)

title: Basic Examples

title: Using Trials
text: Let’s explore nature dataset. looks like visualizing trials.  ’s facet trial:  can now see issue: trials collected continuous clock like align common time (.e., trials start zero). align_trials comes handy:  ’s another example. Let’s say wanted facet wombat trial y axis instead. can easily align trials using align_trials=T:
code: ggplot(wombats,         aes(x=seconds,             y = wombat,             behaviour = behaviour,            color=behaviour)) +   geom_ethogram()  #> Warning: Using `size` aesthetic for lines was deprecated in ggplot2 3.4.0. #> ℹ Please use `linewidth` instead. #> No observation interval provided, using guessed interval 5 #> No observation interval provided, using guessed interval 5 #> No observation interval provided, using guessed interval 5 #> No observation interval provided, using guessed interval 5 ggplot(wombats,         aes(x=seconds,             y = wombat,             behaviour = behaviour,            color = behaviour)) +   geom_ethogram() +   facet_wrap(~trial) #> No observation interval provided, using guessed interval 5 #> No observation interval provided, using guessed interval 5 #> No observation interval provided, using guessed interval 5 #> No observation interval provided, using guessed interval 5 #> No observation interval provided, using guessed interval 5 #> No observation interval provided, using guessed interval 5 #> No observation interval provided, using guessed interval 5 #> No observation interval provided, using guessed interval 5 #> No observation interval provided, using guessed interval 5 #> No observation interval provided, using guessed interval 5 #> No observation interval provided, using guessed interval 5 #> No observation interval provided, using guessed interval 5 #> No observation interval provided, using guessed interval 5 #> No observation interval provided, using guessed interval 5 #> No observation interval provided, using guessed interval 5 #> No observation interval provided, using guessed interval 5 ggplot(wombats,         aes(x=seconds,             y = wombat,             behaviour = behaviour,            color = behaviour)) +   geom_ethogram(align_trials=TRUE) +   facet_wrap(~trial) #> No observation interval provided, using guessed interval 5 #> No observation interval provided, using guessed interval 5 #> No observation interval provided, using guessed interval 5 #> No observation interval provided, using guessed interval 5 #> No observation interval provided, using guessed interval 5 #> No observation interval provided, using guessed interval 5 #> No observation interval provided, using guessed interval 5 #> No observation interval provided, using guessed interval 5 #> No observation interval provided, using guessed interval 5 #> No observation interval provided, using guessed interval 5 #> No observation interval provided, using guessed interval 5 #> No observation interval provided, using guessed interval 5 #> No observation interval provided, using guessed interval 5 #> No observation interval provided, using guessed interval 5 #> No observation interval provided, using guessed interval 5 #> No observation interval provided, using guessed interval 5 ggplot(wombats,         aes(x=seconds,             y = trial,             behaviour = behaviour,            color = behaviour)) +     geom_ethogram() +     facet_wrap(~wombat) #> No observation interval provided, using guessed interval 5 #> No observation interval provided, using guessed interval 5 #> No observation interval provided, using guessed interval 5 #> No observation interval provided, using guessed interval 5 #> No observation interval provided, using guessed interval 5 #> No observation +     geom_ethogram(align_trials = T) +     facet_wrap(~wombat) #> No observation interval provided, using guessed interval 5 #> No observation interval provided, using guessed interval 5 #> No title: ggplot2 extension to plot ethograms
text: goal ggethos provide user-frienldy way plot ethograms using ggplot2.

title: ggplot2 extension to plot ethograms
text: point, experimental package, can install development version GitHub : ’s CRAN, can install released version ggethos CRAN : development version GitHub :

title: ggplot2 extension to plot ethograms
text: basic example plotting ethograms ggethos: Let’s plot behavior wombats  Let’s look using proper x axis separating trials:  Can align trials? Yes! Use align_trials = TRUE:
code: library(ggplot2) library(ggethos) library(dplyr) wombats %>%    group_by(wombat) %>%    slice(1:2) #> # A tibble: 8 × 9 #> # Groups:   wombat [4] #>   wombat trial behaviour trial_frame frame seconds exp_dt              #>   <chr>  <int> <chr>           <int> <int>   <dbl> <dttm>              #> 1 gimli      1 <NA>                1     1       0 2019-08-28 06:37:44 #> 2 gimli      1 <NA>                2     2       5 2019-08-28 06:37:44 #> 3 jerry      1 <NA>                1     1       0 2020-09-21 22:16:33 #> 4 jerry      1 <NA>                2     2       5 2020-09-21 22:16:33 #> 5 pomelo     1 digging             1     1       0 2019-09-20 23:57:04 #> 6 pomelo     1 digging             2     2       5 2019-09-20 23:57:04 #> 7 speedy     1 pondering           1     1       0 2020-01-14 08:37:44 #> 8 speedy     1 pondering           2     2       5 2020-01-14 08:37:44 #> # … with 2 more variables: start_dt <dttm>, end_dt <dttm> # x axis will be in sample space ggplot(wombats, aes(y=wombat, behaviour=behaviour)) + geom_ethogram() # x axis will be in seconds ggplot(wombats, aes(x=seconds,                      y=wombat,                      behaviour=behaviour,                     color=behaviour)) +    geom_ethogram() +   facet_wrap(~trial) # x axis will be in seconds # trials re-aligned ggplot(wombats, aes(x=seconds,                      y=wombat,                      behaviour=behaviour,                     color=behaviour)) +    geom_ethogram(align_trials = T) +   facet_wrap(~trial)

title: ggplot2 extension to plot ethograms
text: preliminary release package still much experimental. Please file issues improve .

title: Ethogram Geom Wrapper — geom_ethogram
text: Ethogram Geom Wrapper

title: Ethogram Geom Wrapper — geom_ethogram
code: geom_ethogram(mapping = NULL, data = NULL, stat = "etho",   position = "identity", ..., size = 5, arrow = NULL,   lineend = "butt", linejoin = "round", na.rm = FALSE,   show.legend = NA, inherit.aes = TRUE, align_trials = FALSE,   remove_nas = TRUE)

title: Ethogram Geom Wrapper — geom_ethogram
text: mapping Set aesthetics created `aes()` `aes_()`. specified `inherit.aes = TRUE` (default), combined default mapping top level plot. must supply `mapping` plot mapping. data Data provided plot provided previous `ggplot(data, ...)` layer stat statistical transformation use data layer, string. default ("etho") use `StatEtho` `ggethos` plot ethograms computing bounds call [ggplot2::geom_segment()]. Changing generate ethograms. position Position adjustment, either string, result call position adjustment function. ... arguments passed [ggplot2::layer()]. often aesthetics, used set aesthetic fixed value, like colour = "red" size = 3. may also parameters paired geom/stat. size Line size. Default=5, increase thicker ethogram plots. arrow specification arrow heads, created arrow(). lineend Line end style (round, butt, square). linejoin Line join style (round, mitre, bevel). na.rm `FALSE`, default, missing values removed warning. `TRUE`, missing values silently removed. show.legend logical. layer included legends? `NA`, default, includes aesthetics mapped. `FALSE` never includes, `TRUE` always includes. can also named logical vector finely select aesthetics display. inherit.aes `FALSE`, overrides default aesthetics, rather combining . useful helper functions define data aesthetics inherit behaviour default plot specification, e.g. [ggplot2::borders()] align_trials boolean indicating whether align trials zero (default = FALSE) remove_nas boolean indicating whether remove `NAs` data (default = TRUE)
